OTERWISE,, Give us your money and (inappropriate language)!!!  No respite for the weary traveller,, (inappropriate language) because YOU are only worth what you spend in the last half hour. but you better keep shopping or we will (inappropriate language) off the lot!

Name: Joseph Barr
Comment: Jeremiah from the Quaker Road Walmart went out his way to help me tonight. There was no iced coffee that my wife was looking for on the shelf. I asked Jeremiah if there was any in the back, he checked and went back and got me 1. Usually I get if its not on the shelf we don't have any.

Name: Sam mlouhi
Comment: Prices high service bad sell for less no longer what Walmart stands for I spend $342 for a pair of glasses on the new Westside store in El Paso tx and the manager was not helpful after I waited 2 weeks she made me feel like how dare you get made itâ€™s not us itâ€™s the lab and I am still waiting itâ€™s not my first glasses never had to wait that long before and pay that much

Name: Jsm
Comment: Walmart south commercial in Salem Oregon is the worst getto store Iâ€™ve ever been to check your receipts at the door like your a criminal employees start and promote fights in the store this store is the most HORRIBLE store and experience of my life again this store is trash no way around it we should all shop elsewhere to promote change cause they sure donâ€™t give a flying f*** there

Name: Lita Kaler
Comment: Small order, half not available. Going on 45min wait for pick up. Really?

Name: Nate Pau
Comment: Buyer BEWARE I ordered a shampoo from walmart. They sent me the wrong item. I sent a picture of what they sent me. It was a hardship on me because I am a physician on the frontlines and I work a lot. In order to get my money back i had to go stand in line at the post office and return it. Before this was even initiated I was told over and over by walmart that I had to make contact with their seller. It took me 1 week of begging the seller to let me have my money back. They did no t wantt o send me the right itrm or give me mymoney back. They told me to send pics of the item and i did exactly what theys aid so they could giveme mymoney back. After going through all of that they never asnwered me back. I messaged them more than 4 times and nothing! Walmart will back the seller before the paying customer.

Name: Tenpiloto
Comment: On July 11, I ordered a home theater receiver on Walmart.com. The promised delivery date was today, July 24. Walmart was using OJCommerce to fulfill this order. I checked the progress of the order several times, most recently yesterday, and the promised delivery date remained today. Then this morning I received messages from both OJCommerce and Walmart.com telling me the order was canceled. OJCommerce waited 2 weeks to realize that they could not fulfill this order. And of course now the item is unavailable. SHAME ON YOU WALMART AND OJCOMMERCE!

Name: Catherine
Comment: They have remodeled the store and done away with checkout clerks, the self checkout counters do not display your running order, so, if you have a question about what you were charged - you can't go back and see. I was overcharged on several items. The sound as each item is scanned is confusing if you are near someone else as they check out so, again you can't go back and see if it scanned. I suppose you could try to get someone's attention but they have one clerk for the 20 or so checkout counters. I rarely go there and will continue to rarely go there. And you have to wear a mask but NOT ALL the employees comply. Whay wear a mask when they don't??????????

Name: Brodi Gary
Comment: Love this store and app. Always an amazing experience!

Name: MENBBB
Comment: Literally Grab'n Go !!! A way of the future. This is ahead of its time but so sensible. Prices are in line with anywhere elseâ€™s. The store is simple and only has some basic items. We got beer and snacks. It was fun.

Name: Karla
Comment: Walmart not having Apple Pay is laughable. Reminds me why I love Target.

Name: Susan Dickey
Comment: Walmart.com failureâ€¦Did not receive items. Call went to Pakistan, where I couldnâ€™t understand the accent. Found out FedEx delivered incorrect. Representative couldnâ€™t reorder, will take a week or longer to get money back. It was toothpaste for goodness sakes. Very POOR customer service. Now I have to keep checking to see if I get my money back. ðŸ‘ŽðŸ˜¡

Name: M Y
Comment: a lot of the product they sell only have factory code for the manufacture date/expire date instead of showing it in month/year format. I found a lot of the items i bought were either unable to check the expire date online at all or some were expired years ago because they just assume no one would look up the factory code online. The worst item i bought was a pet skincare product, according to the code, it was expired 5 years ago. Their rewards mastercard is just another joke, they literally printed a website (walmartfinancial.ca ) on the card which DOES NOT EXIST.

Name: George Jimenez
Comment: I used to be an employee at Walmart on New Road Waco Texas and I was so excited to actually be a part of this job but as soon as I started my day they immediately made me feel like I did not belong there they quickly Judge Me by my appearance and my disability mind you I have already told them about my disability but they thought I was lying until months ago on and they realize and start to see my signs after that it went all downhill they didn't want to help me understand my tasks and my assignment and whenever I did do my assignment it was never good enough for them so much so that they literally labeled me as a bad employee and I told them I do my best to understand what I'm supposed to do but I can't understand something if my manager cannot be a leader and teach me how I told them over and over and I'll do better but then it just kept on going worse and crazier to the point where my manager started to make fun of my disability and compare my disability to another employee's disability when I confronted the head up manager at this Walmart all she just told me it was my word against my team lead they didn't even want to hear me out or hear what I was going through I tried my best to turn the other cheek because I really did want to go far in this job but I couldn't see a future with Walmart if she was manager I remember multiple times she would pull me aside from the rest of my coworkers just to talk down on me and to talk down on my work it got to the point where couldn't take it

Name: Missy
Comment: Good service. Cheap and lots of products.

Name: John kubler
Comment: The customer service is non existent. Employees ignore your request and donâ€™t seem to care that Iâ€™m about to walk away from a $200.00 sale. Management had better get their heads out of whatever crack they have it jammed into. I can always be ignored at Targets!

Name: Jeremy
Comment: The Walmart by me is great. Always clean and always a bargain. I wish they had a few more human cashiers though. Self check-out doesn't always work well.

Name: Erica
Comment: I just purchased 2 laptops for a very good price via walmart.com during our states tax free weekend, but as usual you email me 2 days later to cancel because "you're out of stock." Now a "3rd party" seller has it at a higher price. Yeah, that's a sneaky upsale if I ever saw one. This happens everytime with you. I purchase all of my children's Christmas gifts online every year from many different companies, make 95% of all my purchases online and yet Wal-Mart is the ONLY company I've ever had an issue with. Please tell me how is it that Wal-Mart is such a large company yet the system only updates stock every 24 hours?! You made us miss out on taking advantage of our tax free weekend and now all you can do is try to upsale me? I'm not even one to write things like this and I simply don't have the time but I'm just so disgusted with these sneaky tactics. I homeschool our 2 children and these computers were pivotal for their education. Thanks for once again letting me down!!

Name: Sobeida MartÃ­nez
Comment: Please donâ€™t come to Walmart to buy this or any kind of battery. They are stealing from people that buy batteries there saying has 5 warranty but they donâ€™t mention is the batteries they are selling are defectives and even the replacement donâ€™t last 5 years. Less than 5 years and they want to charge me for a new battery because one of their â€œmechanic name Luisâ€œ said itâ€™s my car fault without check my car and looking the damage on the battery. This is unbelievable. This is my last time with Walmart.

Name: Joe Ainslie
Comment: I cant stand walmarts anymore.I spend for me and family over 20grand a year but that money is about to go elsewhere.Between the pallets everywhere no matter when you go there and the lazy person at the door checking reciepts(you know cause the security cameras and the people standing in lanes arent enough)Ive see started shopping anywhere else I can

Name: Junior Becton
Comment: I went there and had a bad experience tried calling to talk to manager and let them know whatâ€™s going on and been calling for 15 min and no answer... They Really Suck!

Name: Marie
Comment: I worked for Walmart. I was let go because I missed a day since my son was in the hospital. They said that wasnâ€™t a valid excuse to miss work. They have no compassion for their employees. They only care about their profits.

Name: Jake
Comment: In store, told cashier out of box wine. She said she doesn't stock wine. Don't these people get customer service training? She could of said she would let someone know? Website is disfunctional. No wonder Amazon is eating Walmarts lunch.

Name: Kelly Funk
Comment: Horrible!! Walmart is closing like an HR before I walk in been standing in line for 20 minutes, 5 registers open and slow as hell. This place has never made customers happy with their work ethics.

Name: Robert G
Comment: Am trying to get my local store to stock a specific brand of Non-Alcoholic Beer.... Absolutely no way to get to anyone who counts... Tried online chat and calling local customer service will negative results. Guess I will have to find another source.

Name: Jonathan Deal sr
Comment: Your business is going to lose a lot of income not accepting cash almost everyone I know says their going eles where gotta to remember Christians like me believe in the mark of the beast thats millions of people daily around the USA going eles where

Name: Jeannette Kleimann
Comment: I will never buy makeup in Walmart again. I can not sit there and wait for someone to open the locked cabinets every time I want something, it is more than extremely inconvenient and frustrating!!!

Name: dlmaed1
Comment: I received two substitutions for an online order. (At-risk group, so I order from home.) Both were inappropriate but one was particularly hard to understand: I ordered a thermometer because I don't have one, they substituted thermometer tips. Now what am I going to do with those if I don't have a thermometer - not much thought put into that! When I tried to start a refund online, minutes after receiving the order, I got the message that the order was no longer eligible for returns! Tried phoning the store but no one picked up. So I tried the online chat and - bingo! - I was helped very efficiently by Corlas! While Corlas gets 5 stars from me, the whole procedure only gets 3 (and that is only because the chat tool was offered). Walmart needs to make the return process more user-friendly.

Name: Anna Messmer
Comment: honestly they dont even deserve 1 star. This is the second time in the past month they have steered me wrong. First time I ordered an inflatable pool (2 in stock at a store across town) so i say thats fine its not the closest walmart but its hard to find pools right now. Between the time where I placed my order and the order was taken off of the shelf by an employee for me to come pick up (i am assuming this is what happened) someone had bought the last 2. Walmart Cancelled my order. HORRIBLE service. THEN i go to order a karaoke machine for my daughter...in store pickup within about a week ok thats fine...2 days before her birthday it should be ready ... we are waiting patiently as Thursday comes around and the order is pushed to Friday, friday comes around (at 7 pm i get an order delayed email) i call them and they say the order was yet again CANCELLED. Thanks for almost ruining my daughters birthday. DONT WORRY Target made it right and we bought their last one they had in stock TARGET TO THE RESCUE I am so done with Walmart. This is just one reason why i never shop here.

Name: Kislev A.
Comment: What an interesting concept. I could certainly get behind this as I now discovered that going to the grocery store for work lunches is easy, convenient, fast and offers more options and is cheaper than going to a restaurant.  If I was working in the area, and it looks like Amazon Go is located at the heart of the Amazon complex/campus, you can just walk in and walk out to grab your lunch, snacks and drinks and not stand in line. Almost like a cafeteria at work, Very cool.  Very interesting.

Name: Hoda Samii
Comment: I placed an order (food item) on Walmart.com More than two weeks ago, the order never arrived even though they had already charged my credit card. I called their customer service people and asked them to cancel my order, the guy with very limited English told me that they could not cancel the order!! He offered to send an email to the seller and ask if they would cancel it!!!!! He said the seller will contact you within 48 hours to let you know if it was possible to cancel because the order was probably shipped!! FYI: there is no tracking info available. I asked to speak to a manager, he said let me see if they are available to talk to you!! I had the honor to talk to this manager, he repeated the same exact thing, of course I had to guess some of what he was trying to say in English. I ended up hanging up the phone. My credit card company helped me file a complaint and issued a refund for me. I would never trust Walmart. Good thing we have Amazon.

Name: Robert Sipes
Comment: After an online order snafu I immediately cancelled the order within 30 minutes. They sent the order anyway to an undeliverable address and charged me. The item was not accepted and fedex returned it to Walmart. After 4 phone calls and 1 week they still will not refund the $228 they stole from me.

Name: Michael Jobin
Comment: walmart.com is a complete waste of time! I ordered tires from them, first time the order was canceled when the items were due to arrive. i gave them the benefit of doubt and ordered them again... this time only three tires showed up and after two weeks of calling and showing up to pick up my order, they cancelled my one tire order. WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO WITH THREE TIRES???!!! NEVER BUYING ANYTHING FROM THEM AGAIN!!

Name: Sergio Aguilar
Comment: Horrible customer service. The manger, Cecilia at the Rosemead, California store was horrible with no communication skills. She kept saying that it was this particular store policy and that she didn't have to explain herself to anyone. She even called the security guard because she refused service us.

Name: L. Eubanks
Comment: I am currently at the WalMart located at 5501 Hwy 6 in Missouri City, TX. An East Indian employee in the auto department was very rude to me and other customers. I explained to him that I had been waiting for 45 minutes without receiving a ticket for service to have a tire replaced and what the procedure is for customers to follow for service. He bluntly and rudely told me that if I hadn't received a ticket then I wasn't getting a tire today. He then told me to go outside. I told him I had already been outside and they told me to wait inside. He bluntly and rudely told me again that I wasn't getting a tire today. I walked to the door to talk to an outside employee who respected customers and the East Indian man would not press the buzzer for me to exit. I had to ask him if he would let me out! I explained the situation to the on duty manager and he simply stated he would talk to him later. I then called Corporare who simply said they would forward my complaint to the manager which is not helpful at all given I just spoke with him. I will definitely not refer anyone to shop WalMart and advise them to shop some place where customers are treated well.

Name: LACY
Comment: My local walmart is always willing to help. Love the local grocery pickup. Can find things with ease online.

Name: Angela Baker Childers
Comment: 1 regular lane open and the scan &gos. 22 of us in this 1 lane. Wth is going on?

Name: Bev of NOHO
Comment: UPDATE#2 ........(PLUS 1 STAR) (See below for original review) Since my first update on their customer service, Walmart reached out in response to my review. Not only did they ask how my experience could've been improved but they refunded me 20% and gifted me $25 on my next purchase. It was totally unexpected and has modified my opinion on their customer service caring about their customers. Hopefully my next experience will warrant 4 or 5 stars. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ORIGINAL REVIEW I'm a very new Walmart customer. I've never had enough confidence in the quality of products to purchase from the stores. However, online I found hard to find name brand items for less than anyone else offered and with free shipping. I couldn't pass that up.  - Unfortunately, the large ticket item's delivery date kept changing without explanation. If not for the cost savings I would've canceled straight away. - Customer service, however, was very efficient. She was patient with me and my angry rant. Was able to find an acceptable reason for the delay that satisfied me.  I'll definitely purchase again (name brands only), if the savings warrants and I don't need it right away. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ UPDATE: CUSTOMER SERVICE DOESN'T LISTEN. (MINUS 1 STAR) I had 3 customer chats about the same product, above was my 2nd, this is about my 3rd. I contacted them when I received a "delivered" email but no package. She claimed the system had gotten ahead of the driver, even though he described specifically where he'd left the package at the location. She refused to listen. Now I have to wait AGAIN for a replacement. I was offered NOTHING to compensate for the inconvenience. - I'm not sure now the savings is worth the frustrations and headaches. I totally get the low ratings now.

Ultimately I had to return the item, and they told me to return it to the store. Name: Stuart
Comment: This is the worst shopping experience I've ever had.  I bought from Walmart Online because it's the only big box store in town, so I figured I could return it if it didn't work out. It didn't (through no fault of theirs), but they wouldn't let me return it to the store, it had to be picked up for a shipping company.  I wasn't called to arrange a time so they marked it as a no-show twice, then I finally got them to pick it up... that was a month ago. Still waiting on my refund. After many calls to Walmart and conversations with people who are reading a script with no authority to do anything about it, and they don't like to transfer me to someone who can actually help. It seems the shipping company lost it, but Walmart won't refund me until it gets back to them, as opposed to the shipping company.  So basically my money is being held hostage because of a problem that I have no control over. If I could take the item back, at least I could do something. But it's out there, somewhere, and there's nothing I can do about it other than write a review.  I'll never show Walmart Online again. Take my money, Jeff Bezos... at least you give me refunds when I ask for them.

Name: Heather mcgill
Comment: I went to WalMart to print a couple photos from my wedding, which was several years ago. I used the self printing station to transfer photos from my phone gallery and then went to the counter to pay, the man asks me if I took the photos myself (which I obv didn't since I was in them), I said no. He asked for my contract with the photographer, which I didn't have since A) it was several years ago and B) my husband took care of it. He explained I needed to prove the photos were mine to duplicate. I tried to call the photographer but they didn't answer. Then he gets some other associate to come "help" him. At that point I was on the phone with my husband asking if he had a copy in his email of the contract and she began talking over me even though I was on the phone trying to straighten this all out. She then flat out accused me of stealing the prints by taking a photo of a photo. I pointed out that the photographer logo would still be present if the photos weren't mine and she said I cropped them out. I asked wouldn't the logo be in the middle of the photo? She said some pictures had better quality than others and that meant I was stealing them. At this point I was shaking, I have not and would not steal from anyone. I tried showing both associates that I had the entire album on my phone, crystal clear with no logos and they said they did not want to see them, well I am sorry but you are asking me for proof over and over and that was as close as I could get to proof and then you don't want to see them? I understand protecting rights, but I feel like these 2 associates were completely out of bounds and mishandled the situation left and right and instead chose to create a scene and accuse a customer of theft, loudly, even while I was calling around to obtain proof we purchased the rights. Even the customer behind me was uncomfortable and left the line. A manager should have been called immediately if there was doubt, not 2 associates ganging up on a customer. Luckily, when I called my husband back, he remembered we have a USB drive with all our pictures that was given to us by the photographers and we went to a different store to print the photos that I wanted. When I posted about this interaction on Facebook, I am apparently not the only person displeased with the photo dept and one person even told me they shredded her photos in front of her even though it was a photo she took with her own camera. I will not be returning to the Walmart photo dept ever again, and it will be a long time before I step foot in this chain for any other purchases either.

Name: Jessica Z.
Comment: Certainly puts the "convenience" into "convenience store". My boyfriend wanted to check it out while we were visiting Seattle, and yup, it was a cool and quick experience. There were quite a few people inside the small store on the Friday afternoon we dropped by.  To enter, you need the Amazon Go app, which is synced with your Amazon account, on your phone, but you can additionally swipe in family members and others at the turnstiles. My guess is that when someone is swiped in, some information about that person is captured and tied to the account, and then cameras continue to track that person around the store. When someone grabs an item off a shelf, and when that person places it back, it's processed by cameras and sensors. (Notably, Amazon claims that no facial recognition technology is used.) One thing that would be nice is if, while in store, the app told you what items you'd selected as well as the total price in your cart, so that you could see what would be eventually charged. I think after we walked out, the items bought were in "pending" status for a while.  The food is better than your standard convenience store, albeit not super extensive or impressive. There are some pretty decent prepared food options, and some that looked relatively healthy. They've also got some alright snacks and a small fruit section. I walked out with a bag of oddly addicting dry-roasted edamame and one of the few unbruised bananas. Afterwards, we sat by the Spheres (which is a pretty pleasant outdoor area to chill for a bit) to eat our snacks.  If this concept gets big and the stores expand to having more options, that would be awesome. I really like the efficiency of not having to interact with anyone, and not having to self checkout either. It's a novelty now, but it could be the future :)

Name: Michelle
Comment: I've been dealing with Walmart since March 2020, I would have gave a five â­ in the beginning, butif they make sure that my items always come to my address then I would have noncompliant. It got very stressful even for the groceries to get to the right place. I don't have complaints about my refund but I rather have with I order, I'm also a Walmart plus member.. it they do have the best stuff and insurance options hands down.

Name: Mrs Lippincott
Comment: I ordered a Great Value food product. The label clearly states "Our guarantee is our promise that you'll be fully satisfied with the quality of every Great Value product. If for any reason you aren't happy, we'll replace it or return your money. Whichever you prefer. All you need is the package. It's that simple. Guaranteed. Tell us what you think... 1-877-505-2267" The product was ordered last August, but still in the Best if Used By Date. I called the 877 number. Was automatically disconnected. Called again. No answer. Called again, and finally got a person. She transferred me to the wrong department. When I finally got to the right place, the best he would do is give me $$ off my next online purchase of $$$. Of course, I will need to order enough to waive shipping. I would rather shop in person, but they would not do give me store credit. The bottom line... Great Value does not honor their promise or guarantee. There is no timeline on their guarantee. Great Value lies. Walmart lies.

Just another racist happening in 2021....

Like it just came off the grill and done medium. Prices are reasonable and you just leave. Nope, the cops didn't come after us. Very cool.

Comment: This would be zero stars if that was an option. Iâ€™ve tried to order a set of tires on Walmart.com multiple times now in the last couple months. I needed some RV tires and had some Walmart gift cards so I figured Iâ€™d try again and just have them shipped to my house. Hint they donâ€™t. Ordering system sucks, customer service sucks, if I didnâ€™t have the gift cards I would never do business with them again.

So frustrating, so now I have a few items and have to go somewhere else or order them on Amazon. If the items are selling maybe restock them? And donâ€™t you love when the store is packed and they only have 5 registers open but customer service agents will stand around in a pack and talk about their weekends plans and ignore everyone in line. But hey if you want your target base to be food stamps keep at it.

Name: TorSpedIcey
Comment: I worked for walmart for almost exactly one year. The people there in my crew were like family and I loved and still love them all, but management and corporate are the cruelest people I've ever met. Almost every day for that whole year I went home crying, wishing they'd just fire me already. Our store manager only ever focused on the stockers, while everyone in the back room were, at all times, the very last priority. We got paid the same but we were pushed to our very limits every day, and when we questioned him why our jobs kept getting more specific and harder constantly, his response would always be something along the lines of "think of the bigger picture. If the stockers aren't doing all of this they get the products on the shelves faster" but us doing that makes the process longer because we're getting the products out later, proving all any of them think about is the stockers. The stockers will do half their job sometimes and shove what they didn't feel like doing in the back room for the next day and the manager will get onto us for it. I know they do this because I have friends who stock, they never get in trouble and their jobs keep getting easier with more new policies. We're not allowed overtime but if we don't stay late we get coached and this applies to only the backroom (at least at store 622). I've overheard a woman talking with an associate telling her to leave early because she had 26 minutes of overtime, which is ridiculous. When we stay late busting our a**es they call us and tell us to come in late to cut our overtime, which we "technically" have a legal right to refuse, but if we do we get b****ed at. Lastly, I got fired for having too many points. I got called in the office and questioned about it. When I told them my doctor told me not to walk on my foot AT ALL but I've only been calling in the days it hurts very very bad, they then still proceeded to fire me. A guy in my crew had 4 more call ins than I had just a few weeks prior and he got his points completely removed, which shows me that they don't care about the points and they're showing favoritism.

Name: Vivian T Oliva
Comment: I have had a Walmart Credit card for few years. After starting my credit limit from $500 due to good payments on my part twice, without my asking for it, I received 2 increases from Walmart, for being a good customer I was told. I never defaulted on any payment and then just last month I decided to pay entire balance on all my credit cards including Walmart which I paid on June 18th to keep them clear and have them ready for the holidays. 1 month later a Credit Bureau alerts me Walmart closed my account asking if this was accurate. I never received a notice about my Walmart account being paid by the Credit Bureaus as they did all other cards congratulating me after those cards reported my payment. Walmart did not report mine with them as paid which helps my credit score. Instead Walmart alerted Bureaus that they made the choice to close out my account. That hurt my credit. I thought probably that I had not re-used the card again was the reason, although it had only been a month, so how could they close it for that. I contacted Walmart online to ask why and they said because I am no longer considered a holder with worthiness of their credit. I asked what does that mean and why? I was told first that I was wrong on live chat that the account was open and I said I just logged in and it says it has been closed I am looking right at it now, so right out of the gate they were getting their information incorrect. That person transferred me to another person and they said Walmart saw something on my credit report to another place that has nothing to do with them and decided I was no longer Worthy of their credit due to that information the credit bureau was giving them. They said it is their policy. They apologized for their decision. I asked, Doesn't credit history get considered prior to giving credit cards? I was given one and there was no issue then. I was worthy then but now that I have shown good payment history and finally paid every penny of it to bring total to $0 I am not worthy? I never received notice so they said notice is coming expect it in a few days. I was given a snipid of the letter online so I could see that is where I read the â€œWorthinessâ€ line. Then the live chat rep has the audacity to tell me to keep up with my payments. WHAT? Will I be charged a monthly/yearly fee? For a card I am no longer to have? I think this is injust and unfair to a good long term consumer. Not that my issue will make or break Walmart so please no rolling of the eyes at my notice as just another complaint in the massive amount I know Walmart receives. Consider things and look at it as humans with good business sense. How discriminatory and ridiculous is this? As I informed a few co-workers they showed me their cards and history and it is awful and one showed me she paid hers off over 6 months ago and she is a single mom with horrible credit yet her credit and account is still active. What is the criteria that resulted in my results? I understand this Is final but would like express myself and not expect a standard stupid response that deep down as you write it to me you damn well know it is ridiculous. Had I not paid off in full and just made my minimum payments made your decision different? Then I could have kept my account? What is this Walmart? All other credit cards I paid off sent me thanks and one increased my credit limit. Walmart decides this? No one else cared what my history shows now they just know they get good money from me and they wish to continue getting good money from me.  Disgusting, disgraceful, shameful, unfair and down-right dumb practices. Punish a consumer for what I might do in future based on what someone else said in a report. Something needs to be done to make sure this discriminatory practices do not continue.

Name: Alan Honeycut
Comment: At the East Windsor store the shelves are empty of a great many things. This has been like this for some time. I asked a cashier if the store was closing and she said that they are missing a lot of product but she doesn't know why.

Name: Carol Strobel
Comment: I went to super walmart the other day. I found a rack that was $1.00 items, i found 8 items for that price but the cashier rang them up and the price came up $12.98 or $10.98 so i said no. I said to her the price says $1.00 and that's what i want them for. I went back and took a picture of the rack showing $1.00 and the items on the rack. She called a manager over and i showed the picture and she went back to look. She took a while to come back so i went back to see what she was doing. I reached out and they said nothing they can do since return window has passed. After arguing they only gave me 25% refund back for a $46 item. Seriously???? And the item was faulty like I said! As much $ Walmart makes and as much as I spend there plus paying for + every month you think they'd be kind enough to still do a return for a FULL refund. Companies and their egos/$. Another large corporation putting the screws to American customers.

Name: Karen S
Comment: Why Walmart wonâ€™t get my delivery service again. When you order online some items can only be picked up at the store. You get a message saying item is ready. You have to walk in and scan your item. Sometimes the irem is delivered to you through the machine. Sometimes in a locker bear the kiosk and sometimes they have to have someone deliver it to you. Today, mine was delivered to me by a person. After 10 minutes and no person arriving I scanned again. Waited 10 more minutes and called the store to see what the hold up was. Had I not ordered online, I could have picked it up, paid and been out the door. My time is more valuable than waiting for someone to do work that I could have done faster myself. Online ordering does not save customers time.

Name: William H Bell
Comment: I received an email today saying someone went on the Walmart Online and tried to use my Walmart credit card to make a purchase. Luckily I didn't have enough in my account for it to go through so the email stated "purchase decline for insufficient funds" so I called the number on the back of the card and took care of having Capitol One cancel the card and then went on the Walmart.com and changed my password. I call Walmart customer service to see if I can find out what they tried to purchase and if anything where they were making that purchase from. So after having to listen to a long drawn out automated voice for a good 5 minutes I finally get a human. I explained why I was calling and the steps I have already taken. She asked for the credit card number so I gave it to her, three times because it was obvious she couldn't understand me and couldn't understand what I was inquiring about. So I asked for a supervisor. Another 10 minutes gone by and I get Paula. I again explained the situation and she asked for my credit card number. After the second time she says that maybe I need to speak to Walmart Grocery to see if any denied transactions showed up there. Here's what I learned. Walmart is not prepared to handle fraud actions. When calling customer service there is no option of "disputing a transaction" or even a "if you believe someone was using your card with no authorization". No you get a bunch of babble from the automated voice when you first call then more babble by the reps and supervisor. After being told by the supervisor that she could not access the "grocery" side of Walmart I explained how ridiculous that is that a manager doesn't have access to all the customers info and transaction regardless of what department. So I said go ahead and transfer me to grocery and then I was hung up on. I never raised my voice, or used foul language. Just hung up on by a Walmart manager. I think Walmart and I are done doing business.

Name: PJ Y
Comment: What a joke of a walmart in north conway nh my wife and I spend thousands and thousands of dollars and send thousands of customers to them from a nearby camp I manage in the summer. she misses something on self scan a total of 22.78 on a 160 dollar order and they charge her for shoplifting! She even got double charged for other items with an obvious self scan error! Stay away from this scam! We actually wanted to buy all the items we picked out in the store! The lady was trying to help us with all the items working there but apparently we had missed something even though she said we are all set! We are teachers and have never stolen in our lives! Older security gentlemen was super ignorant and rude through the process on 7-29 I returned all 52 items and bought elsewhere!

I called customer service, and was told I would be receiving a full refund and the missing parts, due to the amount of missing. I have all the screws, and the back boarding of my furniture. Iâ€™m missing cushions, arms, and a whole coffee table.  For the missing parts, the agent Angel I talked to, put in his notes, that I donâ€™t have a car (which I do?) so I donâ€™t cant return it and noted that I didnâ€™t want a refund BUT I said that I prefer not to return the whole item because I didnâ€™t want to wait for another four weeks of getting a product that should have been fulfilled the first time and I would like to be sent missing parts. In no way did I ever mention a car. The customer service Angel, replied that I will be receiving a full refund for the inconvenience and be sent the missing parts. I asked him about four times about the refund because I wanted to make sure thatâ€™s what he said and he said that it would be in my account in a week.  I called customer service again this morning, when I saw the notes about my missing parts because it said I would receive only 60 dollars as compensation and that I donâ€™t have a car so I canâ€™t return the whole item, which again not true. The person Patrick I talked just this morning belittled me and talked to me like I was stupid. I explain that the notes that were written were not accurate and he argued for 10 minutes with me saying that the third party seller was trying to help me in giving me that 60 dollar compensation, and that in no way would they give full refunds unless if I return the item. I was very upset the way he was taking to me, I was trying to tell him what happened and he dismissed me and said that thereâ€™s nothing in the notes... THATS WHY IM CALLING BECAUSE THE NOTES WRITTEN BY THE OTHER CUSTOMER CARE SERVICE ARE INACCURATE. Yes the third party was â€œgenerousâ€ for the 60 dollar compensation. As Patrick said to me but This set was over 400 dollars and it came to me missing half of it and itâ€™s about to get discontinued. If it came to me missing, then itâ€™s going to come to you with missing parts, and at this rate Iâ€™ll still get charged for not sending back all the pieces (because I donâ€™t have them!) Mistakes happen but when Iâ€™m talked to the way that I was just talked to by a customer service representative, when I was just wanting clarification from why it went to full refund to only 60 dollars, and why the notes said I didnâ€™t have a car to return it because that statement was so odd, itâ€™s not right.

Comment: I am very dissatisfied with Walmarts customer service. I purchased some shoes online, they were sent in a bag not a box. From looking at the shoes through the bag, I knew that they were overpriced and looked like they wouldnt last. So i brought them into Walmart to return them, they said they must be in a box. So i suggested that since they are Walmart they must have an empty box to use, she said they werent up front but in the back, so i told her i would go get it she said no employees only, and didnt even agree to get it so i could return the item.. So I called customer service twice.. both representatives proceeded to tell me they couldnt hear me, and I caught one in a lie because he did respond, but then said he couldnt hear me again in order to not resolve my issue., so shoes i dont intend to wear they didnt offer me a prepaid label to return. Are you going to offer full-service, quality online pick-up, or NOT?! What a HUGE let down. I'm sure you won't mind losing a few loyal shoppers; (after-all) it won't put a dent in your enormous profits or success. That (in itself) says a lot about your company. You really should make this right.

Name: Ezpz
Comment: Horrible!  Ordered 4 jugs of cat litter. When they arrived via fedx, one jug was missing a lid and had spilled out into the box. Plus, fed x left the boxes out in the rain with no plastic covering.  What a mess to clean up! Not to mention that my cat thought he had a new litter box so I needed to clean the clumpy mess quickly. And my white pants turned gray and white! Ugh!  I called customer service and the lady offered either a replacement or refund. I chose the replacement, only to see both on the Walmart site and the confirmation email that I was being charged for the replacement!  I called again and the person assured me that I was not being charged. Itâ€™s just the way the system had to do it.  Well, the next day, I looked at my credit card account, and not only was I being charged for the replacement item; there was a pending charge in the full amount of the original order! This was in addition to the completed charge of the original order!  I called again and the third person I spoke with said she would notify finance and it would be resolved. I did get a confirmation email that a refund for the one jug had been initiated.  I will check my account tomorrow and notify my financial institution that a second Walmart charge in the same amount as the original order was NOT authorized.  This was an awful experience on so many levels that I will no longer shop at Walmart- not the store, not online. Iâ€™d rather pay a little more than undergo this stress again.

Name: Chris S.
Comment: It's confusing at first, but rule of thumb is that if it feels like you're shoplifting, you're doing it right. Amazon Go isn't a full grocery store (the technology can't handle by-weight produce, for example) - imagine if 7-11 and Whole Foods had a baby. Download the app to get in and log in with your amazon.com account. You'll get the same payment options you use when you're shopping like it's the '00s. Scan a QR code, walk in, pick up what you want, and leave. You're being tracked by artificial intelligence fed by weight sensors under the food and more cameras than Caesar's Palace. Bear in mind that products are billed to whoever takes them off the shelf - if you hand something to your friend who buzzed in with their own account, you'll still pay for it. If you put something BACK on the shelf and your friend grabs it, they will pick up the tab. One nifty feature is that your receipt (when it does arrive) actually clocks how long you were in the store. I was able to see that it took me less than 20 seconds to grab and pay for a Red Bull this afternoon. The future is now!

Comment: Please be aware that if you buy a product from Walmart, it may be sold to the store by a 3rd party. I purchased a Nordic treadmill and was delivered an older model of the treadmill. It took many phones, including one to the Walmart headquarters to begin to return something I did not order. What appeared to be a good deal turned out to be a major headache. Very disappointing! I will no longer be purchasing products from Walmart.

Walmart canceled the order because of a mixup with the address and never ever texted me or emailed me so I had no idea the order was not in transit

Comment: Walmart.com held almost $500. dollars for a $232. Order. Then said it was a glitch in there computer system and they couldnâ€™t give me my money back for 24 to 48 hrs. Be aware of ordering online. Customer care people lie about it horrible people.

Name: Ron
Comment: I bought a home gym system for $359, delivery in September. On 8/12 I received and email telling me that my order has been cancelled. 8/13 the very next day I receive a new email advertising the same home gym system only now I can get it for $660. HOW DOES THAT WORK

Name: Stephenbkk20156
Comment: couldn't get in We thought a visit to this place would be fun. Found it easily enough. Looks kind of cool from the outside. A glimpse inside: shiny floors, lots of high-end convenience store foods.  BUT a turnstile to get in and you needed a certain app on your phone to get through it. We didn't have the app. We didn't have a phone. We couldn't go in.  A kindly man near the entrance explained this to us, but also said he wasn't an Amazon employee. There were no Amazon employees. That's kind of the point.  Quite understand why the app is needed. Still disappointed. Note to self and others: get the app before going.

Name: deb chandlrt
Comment: app no longer works. employees have no clue. web site is turned off on several selections. OKLA is not turned on to the new web site. they just had to turn the web and app over to a 20 year old bach degree, mis student. but you and amazon control the world right now, so why should you care???

Name: Brian Reese
Comment: All your stores are dirty i would rather shop at Winco Foods.

Name: Donna Vig
Comment: There really should be a zero star on this rating scale. By no means do I put this review on an associate named Robert, he tried to get me assistance twice. I was desparate enough to wait an hour and 20 minutes at the jewelry counter after two pages, one associate goint into the manager who said she's be right out, then two calls to the store while I was in the store and asked for a manager. She actually told me she didn't have their extentions. Finally someone showed up, said not one word, opened the case. I left without purchasing what I wanted because the cross did not come with a chain. I blame the management and the company. The company makes enough money to staff their store. But who cares really. There are millions of customers to take my place.

Name: Janae Arnell
Comment: We bought hummingbird feeders from Walmart and about 3-4 weeks later, all of our hummingbirds stopped eating from our feeders. When we took them down and took them apart they were filled with mold. Super disappointed â˜¹ï¸

Name: Jazmin Davis
Comment: Walmart in buckeye, az on Watson and yuma. They haven't had enough employees to do their jobs so now customers like me are standing in lines for over 10 minutes just to check out in self checkout that was supposed to be faster for people. Half their self checkout machines are not working. Where did customer service go this is not how Walmart was back in the day.

Name: Joyce B. Lanham
Comment: I never shopped at WALMART until I retired 7 years ago and moved to Northeastern Pennsylvania. The nearest WALMART is in Honesdale, much closer to where I live than malls in Scranton. I was pleasantly surprised to find quality casual clothing at my local WALMART. It is largely a self-service store environment; however, whenever I need assistance or have a question, all of the service representatives have be courteous, helpful and professional. In addition to clothing, my WALMART is a full-service department store with a large supermarket and a SUBWAY sandwich shop!

Name: Cathy Michael
Comment: Idk about the rest of you, but I have had it w the way prices keep going up At Walmart! I'm a creature of habit so I buy the same products over and over. I'm a disabled widow who has to be a frugal shopper so I buy cheap when I can. I find a good product at a low cost & stick to it. But I've seen a $6 bag of chicken go up $3+ in 2 months time. Paper products are now unreasonable. So is EVERYTHING ELSE. I shop once or twice weekly and everything I shop, everytime I buy has gone up. I'm a screaming cussing yelling lunatic after shopping. I'm so pissed! I'm on Social Secrity and that's all I get. 6 months back I might have a couple hundred at the end of the month. Now I'm pinching pennies just to get thru the month. I thought WM was founded on the logic of, lower cost so ppl could live better lives? Right? Well sorry to tell ya Ole Sam Walton! But a shister has taken ur place. (I know hes dead) I understand having to increase prices sometimes But COME ON WALMART!!! Ur strangling us to death as a ppl! And the worst part is, once this "crisis" is over, they will never come back down on their prices. They never do. Even my poor baby Yorkie is eating crappier now. I just think they've made enough off us already but these prices are causing me and all of you too much. Don't you agree?

Comment: Idk about the rest of you, but I have had it w the way prices keep going up At Walmart! I'm a creature of habit so I buy the same products over and over. Name: Sarah
Comment: Worst customer service! They will hire anyone off the street for their stores. No training, no qualifications, no management, no check on the employees. The worst workers with the worst and extremely rude attitude and behaviour can be found in Walmart stores.

Name: Kelly
Comment: I waited on hold for the bakery in West Mifflin for 20 minutes, this is not the first time either. I hung up and called north Versailles and got to the bakery and my questions answered in 5 minutes. West Mifflin Walmart just keeps getting worse and worse. It's to the point where I don't even want to go there anymore. Something needs to change. Maybe the person in charge or managers idk but this is ridiculous. That and Everytime I'm there their return policy changes. It depends on the can and the service counter that's there on that day. Nobody follows the correct return policy. And managers are rude cussing out customers and employees. This place is a truly horrible customer service and they have no appreciation for the employees there. Unless some changes are made I will not be going back there

Name: Juan Martinez
Comment: I am so angry with walmart because first they tried to lie to me that my products do not have priority because of kovi19, when days before i made the same product and it arrived quickly, and then they told me if i could wait until 08/17/2020 when the products had to arrive on 12/08/2020, and then i contacted them again and they told me that the product was lost.

They are way behind the pack on online ordering.

Comment: I went to purchase Baileys which I use as a coffee creamer. ID was ready and available however a clearly mid 30s male came up and asked me a question. This dude didn't have an ID so the old hag wouldn't sell me my coffee creamer.

Name: Jake Macklin
Comment: Says "next day shipping", sweet I'll order my product. Receipt immediately tells me it will arrive in 5 days. I would have ordered else where with this knowledge, and certainly will never order from Walmart again.

Name: Alexis Coppinger
Comment: My experience at the Deptford Walmart in New Jersey was honestly pretty upsetting. I am I young girl with not a lot of money I went to pick up a few things usually I go to the self checkout line but it was card only. The employee checking me out had such a horrible attitude like I said I am a young girl with not a lot of money so I had to pay with ones when I handed her the ones she looked at me with disgust and told me that me handing this to her was disrespectful and offensive because they were a little wrinkled I apologized I said sometimes in the wallet I have they get that way and I tried my best to flatten them neatly and she told me that was no excuse. I walked out of there pretty sad because it just felt like I was being scolded and attacked for no reason. Once again this was at the Deptford Walmart in New Jersey and the workers name was cancella. I feel bad leaving this kinda of review but I have really bad anxiety and was just in shock at the way she handled things. As a worker for a fast food place I would never say that to anyone when handling money because I do not know their situation.

Name: bart
Comment: I placed order online few days ago everything was fine. today I placed another order and before I got order confirmation I got cancellation first. I tried to talk to half brainers via chat no answer why it happened. I tried to re order few hours later same crap. another idiot who was clueless. I called the phone line customer service. after 20 minutes fine went dead. no resolution . money has been authorized from my card twice and I have for the funds to be released after the weekend . what a bull crap service. and I still have no option to how to order it.

This is day three I am waiting for school supplies to be delivered to my home. I heard all kinds of excuses but still Walmart doesnâ€™t seem to get it handled to get my items delivered. Comment: This website is absolutely terrible. If you fail to spend 35 bucks or more, you get charged a "less than minimum" fee of 6.99 which is just their "legal" way or robbing you blind. I really do not recommend this website, you're better off going in the store in person so you don't pay out the *** in fees. NOT recommended one bit!

Name: Misty Witter
Comment: Would give it a zero if I could. Was on the free trial and only got 1 out of 3 orders delivered (my very 1st one). The other 2 we're "delayed" and had to be cancelled. Walmart has gone to poop since Mr Sam Walton died!! I'm sure he's rolling over in his grave

Name: Zerochaos
Comment: Hopefully Walmart reads this and cares. Many items do not have prices. More and more items are behind locked cases with no one to help get the merchandise or even see a barcode to scan a price. Examples: motor oil and shotgun shells. The result is that I will do 25% as much purchasing at Walmart this year as I have averaged for the past 10-15. The automotive area has become terribly managed. So much so that there isn't AC or decent working conditions for the mechanics and customers cannot trust the work. Quality of Walmart brand items was once the same as name brands. The quality has plunged. Ex: Oil of olay, cereals, many, many other knock-offs. Many items are not in stock or not in stock consistently. Ex: lawn care supplies, bird feed, glues, paints.

Name: Lule Burrow
Comment: This Review is for the Germantown, MD Walmart. Very rude and unhelpful people at this Walmart. The supervisor screamed at me after getting my curbside pickup order wrong and refused to give me a refund while I waited in the car with my 4 young children. I ended up going inside after calling and them purposely hanging up for a prank or something. I went to the customer service desk and asked who hanged up the phone and they all started to laugh and giggle. After that the â€œsupervisorâ€ ran to the back and slammed the door after claiming that I harassed her. Oh and never a hassle if you have to return something. ONE STOP SHOPPING

Name: Kathy Taylor
Comment: Unbelievable, jewelery scam! Do NOT buy gold jewelry from Walmart. They will NOT provide warranty coverage, even with purchase of extended warranty. For over 3 years I have been receiving calls and emails from customers in this position. They are being told to contact Simply Gold directly to pursue warranty coverage. Unfortunately, I am NOT the right company. I have NEVER been a supplier to Walmart. Please do not buy ANYTHING from their jewellery department.

Name: Steven White
Comment: I recently placed an online order on their website. When I called their customer service after a few hours to make a change to my order I got a "Rep" with all the English speaking skills of a 3 year old. A simple change that should only have taken a mere seconds turned into into 30 minutes of frustration. I'm all for equal opportunity for "qualified" people. This does not speak well at all to Walmart's so called commitment to customer service. If you put someone in in a customer service position, make sure they can communicate effectively!

Comment: I always get what I expect from Walmart. - Subpar customer service - Low-quality products - Low prices

And today I even had the assistance from a customer service representative, who assured me my items would be available for pickup. Never again. I hate to say it but Target never has this problem.

The other dress I ordered said it's color was purple, but they sent me pink. I wrote to them several times now and I've gotten no response or replacements. We were so patient to wait an hour and half but we got nothing. Such a bad customer service. Not even a â€œsorry for the inconvenience or whatsoeverâ€. We ended up leaving and cancelling.

Name: HT
Comment: Using Walmart+ at Murphey's gas is impossible. First, you need to sign on to Walmart Website, but there is NO WiFi coverate at the pump. Therefore, you must go inside the Walmart store to get a WiFi connection so you can sign on. Getting a WiFi connection inside the store is iffy. It seems like their WiFi is off and on. Then when you do sign on, you are given a six digit number you need to input in the pump before you start pumping the gas. A majority of the time the pump says the number you entered is invalid, try again. Upon several attempts to input the number, I just give up and go ahead and buy gas at the non discounted price. I would like a full refund on the appprox. $100 annual membership fee that I paid. But, I'm sure that is an impossibility. So don't waste you money for the membership fee. It isn't worth it.

Comment: We had a very bad experience with online order!!! On Saturday I called and told them what is the process and they told me itâ€™s still getting prepared and then told me this item is out of stuck actually so we would need to cancel this item.... are you frikin serious?!!!! Comment: Donâ€™t bother. What a joke this next day â€˜serviceâ€™ is. I need some essentials and decided to try Walmart instead of amazon. It was a bit cheaper than amazon, and I wouldnâ€™t have to actually go into the store. I made sure to only choose next day items, which in some cases were different sizes or brands than the ones I wanted. It said I ordered too late Saturday to get them Sunday, so Iâ€™d get them Monday. Ok. No problem. Then Sunday I get an email saying my shipment would be here next week! Now I have to go to the store anyway, and next week Iâ€™ll have extra items in larger sizes or brands than I wanted. Great.  Contacted customer support. Very nice. But he said there were a few broken or missing items so they moved my whole order up a week.  Never mind, Walmart. You canâ€™t compete with Amazon, apparently.

Name: lexter266
Comment: Cute Store-Easy Check Out I had to give it a try for a new way to shop at grocery without cashier. I had Amazon app on my phone a d thatâ€™s what everyone entering Amazon Go needs to have in order to buy something. After activating my app, a QR code appeared on the screen which I used to scan at the entry to enter small gate. I grabbed a sandwich and walked out the gate. That was it. It later sent me a receipt to my email. At the exit area, there condiments, tap water, cups, napkins, etc. It was fun, but not sure I like it! First of, a lot of people will their jobs because of this kind of technology, which I donâ€™t want to support. Less human interactions with each other only turn us to alienate each other! We have enough people on this planet who are willing to work to support themselves, unless everything is free. I hope this system is not a new norm to how we shop soon.

Name: Jane M.
Comment: Super convenient store in seattle downtown.. if you are hungry and want to grab a bite and have forgotten your wallet but you do have your smart phone with amazon app well this is your go to place..hi tech store and innovative concept for amazon users..

Name: Thomas
Comment: second items I have purchased from Walmart.com both have been canceled from supplier with no reason given. I'm thinking Walmart.com is some type of scam.

Name: Jamie Hopkins
Comment: Terrible. I ordered a 15$ 5qt bottle of motor oil. They send me 3 5qt bottles of the wrong motor oil. Cannot use it..I contact them and they tell me I have to return the motor oil in order to get my refund. I tell them I will leave the package for FedEx (something I have done with other companies). They tell me no and I have to return it. I explain the reason I order online is that the nearest Walmart is 42 minutes away. They tell me "sorry for the inconvenience"....okay so a multi billion dollar company screws up and then I have to drive 84 minutes round trip (with gas prices at 3.10 per gallon) and waste over 2 hrs of my time (drive, stand in line to return, shop for correct motor oil, stand in line and check out). Seems fair. They again apologize and offer me a 5$ gift card...wow thanks ðŸ™„. I explain this isn't acceptable so they tell me there is nothing to do but keep the wrong oil....looked it up while on the phone with them and it's 30$ per bottle. I explain if I keep it it is 90$ and they again tell me I should return it. Lol...nah keeping it and will return it to the store at a later date and get the 90$ in store credit in lieu of returning it for 15$..... Interesting way to do business...lose $$ and to have policy that screw their customers that order in good faith. Expecting your customers to correct your mistakes...nice. Already pay workers crap and screw them...might as well treat consumers the same way.

Name: jeanne roche
Comment: I ordered a few items and was told they were on the way. Then I received an email stating the items were on back order. The site said a two day delivery, which is apparently not true. One of the items I ordered would have taken almost two weeks to arrive. They had no problem advertising two daily delivery time, but it rarely ever happens.

Name: Alice Scott
Comment: Customer service is very poor. Every agent that I spoke with had a foreign accent, making understanding them extremely difficult. I received an email stating that I had received my items. The accompanying photo of the delivery was the steering wheel of an automobile, not my home. I informed the Walmart associate that I donâ€™t live in a car. The associate then claimed that I had received numerous refunds, which was a lie. Also the day of the supposed delivery, another associate called to state that the driver hadnâ€™t placed the items correctly in the computer, and that I wouldnâ€™t be receiving them. Dealing with Walmart customer service is extremely frustrating. I plan to avoid Walmart from here on.

Name: Gerri Fico-Kelly
Comment: Every time I order from Walmart online, there is a problem. Something is always missing and I end up having to write, email, call, etc. just to get the items I have paid for. It has happened yet again! I ordered a two-pack of hair color. It reads Rollback, (2 pack) for $9.76. I ordered 2 of this item and they charged me for 2 for $19+. I should have received 4 boxes of the item. Again....I only received two. I paid for 4 and only received 2. No one there will help me. I have been emailing all day long and getting nowhere. I started at 11 this morning and the last email was 5:30 tonight. The last email tonight around 5:30 pretty much told me they can change their pricing, etc. and to read the policy. That's just bull. I already paid for something and they wont send it to me. How is this legal that they can charge me for an item, refuse to send it, then tell me it's just too bad? They're keeping my money and not sending me the item I paid for.

Name: Mike Burbank
Comment: I will not use walmart.com again. Their lackadaisical attitude towards your order is mind blowing! I ordered a tent on Saturday needing it by Wednesday. Well the box arrived but my tent was not in it, it was an Igloo cooler going to New York. The Middle Eastern gentleman I was talking to said I can keep it, give it away, or take it to the store. The actual shipping label was in the cooler. He then told me the soonest I could get said tent was on Thursday. I told him that would not work I need by Wednesday. He said the other option is to cancel, get a refund and a cheap twenty-five dollar gift card. I told him that was not good enough. I asked him if the refund had been taken care. He said yes. I then replied I am finished with you have a nice evening. After the phone call I returned the Igloo cooler to my local Walmart where I ended up having to buy their version of the same tent at almost the same price. I even suggested sending it to a local Walmart where I could pick it up later on Wednesday which he replied I can not do that. So some poor woman is not going to get her Igloo cooler but something else, probably my tent.

When I contacted them, I was told they would "rush" a replacement shipment and it would arrive in two days. Instead, the items weren't re-shipped at all. I finally got notification that the order had been resubmitted but wouldn't arrive for nine days. When I contacted Walmart.com, the "customer service representative" asked, "What do you want me to do about it?" Really? No other solution or compensation was offered. At first he even told me I couldn't cancel the order because it was "in transit." Finally, the order was cancelled but I was told it would take a week to process a refund. Wow. Really great "customer service" Walmart.

Then what happens is this computer that was never picked up and I had canceled the order mind you shows up on my front porch. Someone replaced the order it was either the computer store or Walmart. Walmart is saying they did not replace the order that they cannot do that. another issue with Walmart they are dealing with these 3rd party companies and you might be ordering something from China. I'm not sure if I will ever order from them again.

I believe the damage was done by them.  I use to love shopping here, but I am so upset that I can't keep giving them my money.  I will continue to write a post about this because I believed in Walmart.

Name: Dorothy B
Comment: Had to check it out... This was by far the most interesting shopping experience I have had in a while. You literally download the Amazon Go app on your phone, scan your phone and enter. You can have up to four people including yourself join you. The store is very well laid out. The prices are not that bad either. You can buy candy, chips, soda, water, yogurt, fresh fruits and veggies, meals for two that are ready to cook, beer and wine (which they have an attendant carding you before you chose your item), Amazon Go swag, and other items. After you chose your items you just walk out! A few minutes later you receive an email with your receipt! There is a small area if you want to sit and eat you can, there is a microwave, and plastic utensils. The other perk is there is a phone charging station! Definitely would recommend going to visit. If there was one of these in my area I would frequent it often!

This will likely cause you to miss out on that item from other places that drop actual stock.

Name: Stacy Hunt
Comment: We purchased two beds from Wal-Mart and they were delivered in a decent time frame given the complications of COVID. Well, one of the beds had zero hardware included in it. We contacted the manufacturer who were completely unwilling to help so we processed a replacement through Wal-Mart which seemed super easy. They would send a replacement and we had about a month to return the item via a Fed-Ex tracking slip that they provided. Well, a month later I was charged for another bed because they said they never received the item. When I contacted them I was told via a chat exchange that they found the item and I would be issued a full refund within 24 hours. 24 hours came and went an no refund. I contacted customer service again and was told that they never received the item and I would not be getting a refund. This entire purchase has been a nightmare and I will never be purchasing from Wal-Mart again because of it. This review certainly won't affect Wal-Mart at all but hopefully it will make you think twice before purchasing large items online from them. You are safer purchasing elsewhere.

Name: Tammy Redden
Comment: I went to Walmart on Conley Road in Columbia MO, to purchase a T.V. for the company that I work for. After a few days we decided that the t.v was no longer needed. 8 days later I went back to Walmart on Conley Road to return the t.v. Upon arriving to return the t,v. I was informed by an Anna that they had no record of the purchase. I did not have the receipt at the time. It had been submitted to our business office. Another guy who appeared to be over Anna tried to go into the back office to try and find the receipt. They both asked me the date of purchase, which I did not know at the time. He looked up a couple of dates in the back supposebly and came back and said we cannot find the receipt based on your credit card numbers. I stood holding the credit card and he said all I need is the last four numbers of the card. They did not use my card otherwise to track the t.v. I was then informed that I would have to go back to my company and get the receipt because they could not verify the purchase otherwise. While standing at the front counter another employee walked up to ask a question who got in my 6 inch space. I moved out of the way so he could stand at the counter and talk with a co-worker. As I was walking out the door I was asked for a receipt by a security person who walked by a heard the conversation about me not having a receipt. When I asked for a manager a lady name, "Tammy" came to talk with me who said, she would follow up to see what happened about get back with me.She took down no information. She did say sorry that I felt discriminated against. She was very unconcerned with what I was saying to her as well! I have never been refused service for not having a receipt especially when a credit card was used. I know they think ALL black people steal. However, I work at a shelter and I watch people come in with gear from Walmart who do not work. They have shared how one person steals and another person takes it back. I will never pre-correct them again. My words will be get them from now on. Horrible experience all the way around!! I have never felt discriminated against like I felt on Wednesday.

Name: Andrew Zahm
Comment: Ordered a sound system Aug 5. Slated for delivery on Aug 13. Never received the product. Contacted Walmart.com, they contacted 3rd party seller. Seller tells me they sent the package and that it got lost. I say ok, I'll be patient. Then I contact UPS, they never received a packaged. Dude lied to me. Contact walmart.com again to get refund, only I cant get a refund right now, because I just called and talked to the 3rd party and they closed my ticket. No new tickets can be opened for 48 hours. I wait a whole weekend and call 3rd party on Monday. I'm pissed. Leave a nasty message. Call back. Get through to third party. He says they are working on it. I calm down and say I'll call back in 4 days to check on the package. I call back, 4 days later. No package has been sent. In fact, they are now sold out of the item I want and they have another shipment coming in next week. Give me a break. Walmart.com use better third party sellers. Those guys at Cloverfield in New Jersey are a joke! Shame on you for taking my money and leaving it in some place I cant access for a month. I ordered through Walmart, because of issues with Amazon. I'll never order anything for you guys as long as I live.

Comment: I am an old lady who knows nothing in life is perfect. When Walmart.com delivered the wrong order of dishes for my friend to pick up I was frustrated, and even wrote a nasty review. Then I contacted Walmart.com on their chat. They helped correct this mistake. I know that Walmart does not pay livable wages but I have noticed they are beginning to pay better wages and I pray our nation will find the goodness I found from the people who work at Walmart.com. I am so impressed.

Name: Daniel F.
Comment: The Amazon Go store needs to get out and take over all the stores. I'm sorry/not sorry retail workers. You might actually like retail if you're 'stuck' working in an Amazon Go store. The 'deli' workers never have to deal with people. They just churn out delicious grab and go solutions for everyone en masse. I'm not saying that everyone is going to want to grow up and be an Amazon Go worker, but I'd have taken that over working in Golden Corral and smelling like fried chicken for three years. The selection here is actually better for lunch and quick meals than Whole Foods. I'm sure that is Amazon's master plan at monitoring what purchases we make, but it gets me some extra exercise having to walk up the hill to get to the Go store. Add to the fact that because of the constant construction, I've walked past the same adjacent plot to the Spheres many times and had to circle back to the store. Even in the worst cases, the longest time I've spent in the Amazon Go store may be just under three minutes, and that was the first time when a group from work went having no idea what we were doing. The frustrating part (ok, less now months later)? People stopping at the entrance/exit saying 'wait? I can just go?' Even after going several times, I've caught myself questioning what I was doing, and then remembering I literally just need to go away. Have your app ready when you get to the store. It will save you a lot of time during the rush period. If at all possible, leave babies out of the store. Bring your child to work day at the Amazon Go store was a total disaster, but as disasters go, the ease of getting in and out of there in 45 seconds with my breakfast at 7 AM, dodging a few dozen children under 7 was quite impressive. I'm not sure how I made it out alive, but I'm sure Amazon had something to do with it. Wifi is free and good performance in the area so you have no excuse for you app download or it working. They really put this thing through the paces before unleashing it on the public. Did you try to drive here? Get out of town. There is a bike path going in front of the store, so watch yourself heading out the store in case bikers are in the area.

Name: Estela D.
Comment: It's an experience that's for sure! You have to download the Amazon Go app on your phone before you can enter (if you don't already have it), just FYI. Once you scan and you're in, it's simple. You grab a free bag, you pick what you want and when you walk out, and you get charged. A receipt is sent to you maybe 10 minutes after you leave and there you have it. You shopped at Amazon Go.  Prices are pretty good for most things here! I got a bottle of Stella Rosa and it was about $13 (average if not cheaper other places) but they were selling water bottles for 49 cents! Super cheap. It's located right next to Amazon HQ so if you want to pop in there afterward you can. There's plenty of stuff to do around there, since it's close to downtown. I'll definitely be going back to buy little things when I come back to Seattle.

Name: SeattleShrew
Comment: Had to check it out... The beauty of Amazon Go is it's a convenience store with the best checkout experience ever -- none. We go there to buy small salads, yogurt, bread, soda, VitaminWater Zero, etc. But don't overthink this place, it's small and for convenience, it's not a luxe food store. The sandwiches are cold and not particularly tasty, although they are made on the premises (you can see the kitchen from the street windows). This store also gets crazy busy with tourists who aren't buying anything but looking around in wonder. I sneak in, grab what I need and get out of Dodge as soon as possible. A few minutes later I get a detailed descriptions with photos of what I bought and in what quantity. There hasn't been a mistake yet in what I've been charged. Great experiment by Amazon, which will no doubt apply this innovation into other areas. BTW, the Amazon employees who help the uninitiated with the Go app and procedures are very friendly at the scan gates and in the store. One employee was able to check on stock with his handheld computer when I asked if any stock was in the back of a particular item. I like this place.

This has only recently went public about 6 months to a year ago (unsure of the exact time)--so its still a very new and interesting idea. I'm curious if these will start showing up in competition with 7 Eleven stores.
